title: Scheduler
content:
You can use the scheduler to trigger integration scenarios based on a schedule. For example, trigger the Jira Get Status scenario at 10 PM every day.

Create schedules

Perform the following steps to create a schedule:

  1. Click Administration > Utilities > Integration > Integration Studio.
  2. Click the Scheduler tab.
  3. Click + Add on the toolbar. The New Schedule wizard appears.
  4. On the Scenario page, specify a name for the schedule, and select the integration and scenario that must be triggered according to the schedule.

  5. On the Planning page, select the timezone, and then specify the start/end time and the recurrence pattern for the schedule in the Recurrence section.

    You can specify only the date for the schedule's end time. The exact end time is 0:00 of that date.
  6. (Optional) In the Exclusions section of the Planning page, add a list of time slots that are excluded from the schedule. To add an exclusion time slot, select the start time and end time, and then click Add. You can add exclusion time slots based on date time or time.

  7. (Optional) On the Inputs page, click Add Input to add key-value pairs that can be used by scenario rules.

    The Value field on the Schedule form has the following differences with the Value fields on the scenario configuration form:

    • The Integration Studio expression language is not supported on the Schedule form.

    • The value you enter on the Schedule form will always be treated as a string.

    • When you enter a string value on the Schedule form, you don't need to enclose the value in quotes. The Integration Studio will add the quotes when it passes the value to scenarios.

  8. Click Save.
You can't create a schedule for the Microsoft Teams integration.

Manage schedules

You can use the actions on the toolbar to edit, remove, enable, and disable schedules.

The State column of the Schedules grid indicates whether the schedule is enabled ( ) or disabled ( ).

Schedules that already end will be removed from the Schedules grid.

Monitor scheduler-triggered scenarios

As with any integration scenario, use the integration execution logs page (Administration > Utilities > Integration > Endpoints) to view the scenario rules triggered by the scheduler. If an endpoint is associated with several scenarios, add a filter on the scenario name to display only execution logs for a specific scenario that was triggered by a schedule.

Use schedule data in the scenario

Use schedule Input data

In a scenario that is triggered by a schedule, you can use the key-value pairs specified on the Inputs page of the schedule in the scenario's rules. To do this, enter this in the Value field of various parameters in the scenario rule:

payload.data.<key specified in the schedule>

Use built-in data

Schedules also contain a built-in property last_execution_time, which can be directly used in scenarios without being defined first. The property indicates the time when the schedule was last executed and is represented by the Unix timestamp (in milliseconds). If the schedule was never executed, the property returns the Unix timestamp for the current time.

If your scenario rule requires a date-time value for the last execution time, you can use the DSL format function to convert the timestamp to a date format. See DSL functions.

To use this property, enter this in the Value field of various parameters in the scenario rule: payload.data.last_execution_time.
